sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: Custom Truck One Source chief accounting officer to resign in January
feed.summary: Custom Truck One Source, Inc. announced that R. Todd Barrett will resign as Chief Accounting Officer, effective January 16, 2026, a decision not related to company disagreements. This follows the company's recent Q3 2025 earnings which slightly missed EPS and revenue forecasts, primarily due to underperformance in their Truck and Equipment Sales segment. Despite this, Stifel reiterated a Buy rating and an $8.00 price target for CTOS.

feed.title: Custom Truck One Source chief accounting officer to resign in January
feed.summary: Custom Truck One Source (NYSE:CTOS) announced that its Chief Accounting Officer, R. Todd Barrett, will resign effective January 16, 2026, a decision unrelated to any company disagreements. This comes as the company reported a slight miss on Q3 2025 earnings and revenue, though Stifel reiterated a Buy rating due to potential for outperformance.

feed.title: Custom Truck One Source chief accounting officer to resign in January
feed.summary: Custom Truck One Source, Inc. (NYSE:CTOS) announced that its Chief Accounting Officer, R. Todd Barrett, will resign effective January 16, 2026. This resignation is not due to any disagreements with the company's operations. The company, which operates in the equipment rental and leasing sector, recently reported a slight miss on Q3 2025 earnings per share and revenue.

feed.title: Custom Truck One Source Announces Chief Accounting Officer Resignation
feed.summary: Custom Truck One Source, Inc. announced the resignation of R. Todd Barrett as Chief Accounting Officer, effective January 16, 2026. The company stated that his resignation is not due to any disagreement with the company. This information was based on an SEC filing from December 23, 2025.

feed.title: Stock Traders Buy Large Volume of Custom Truck One Source Put Options (NYSE:CTOS)
feed.summary: Stock traders engaged in unusually high put option activity for Custom Truck One Source (NYSE:CTOS) on Thursday, with 2,765 put options acquired, a 1,174% increase from average daily volume. The company's shares traded at $6.15, with analysts holding a consensus "Hold" rating and a target price of $7.13, despite recent negative EPS and net margin. Institutional investors hold a significant portion of the stock.

feed.title: The Toro Company, Custom Truck One Source, U-Haul, Kadant, and TopBuild Shares Skyrocket, What You Need To Know
feed.summary: Shares of The Toro Company, Custom Truck One Source, U-Haul, Kadant, and TopBuild skyrocketed after the Federal Reserve lowered its benchmark interest rate, signaling a more accommodative monetary policy. This dovish action, combined with signals from Chair Jerome Powell, sent the Dow Jones Industrial Average and S&P 500 surging. The market reacted bullishly to the Fed's decision to expand its balance sheet and shift focus towards economic growth, despite the official forecast only predicting one cut for the next year.

feed.title: Kennedy Capital Management LLC Purchases 197,258 Shares of Custom Truck One Source, Inc. $CTOS
feed.summary: Kennedy Capital Management LLC significantly increased its stake in Custom Truck One Source, Inc. (NYSE:CTOS) by 360.1% in Q2, acquiring an additional 197,258 shares. The firm now owns 252,031 shares valued at approximately $1.245 million. Despite this accumulation, CTOS recently missed Q3 earnings and revenue estimates, holds negative margins, and has an average analyst rating of "Hold" with a target price of $7.13.

feed.title: Is CTOS’s Earnings Beat And Higher Guidance Altering The Investment Case For Custom Truck One Source (CTOS)?
feed.summary: Custom Truck One Source (CTOS) reported a recent quarter with a slight revenue miss but an earnings per share beat and strong adjusted operating income. The company also raised its full-year guidance, suggesting management's confidence in operational improvements and demand. This update may influence the investment narrative, particularly regarding its reliance on long-term infrastructure demand versus the pressures of high leverage and thin free cash flow.

feed.title: Custom Truck One Source: Navigating a 7.9% Price Dip on NYSE
feed.summary: Custom Truck One Source (NYSE: CTOS-WT) recently experienced a 7.9% price reduction on the NYSE, dropping to $0.105, influenced by high volatility and sector-wide economic challenges. Despite this, the company operates within the resilient Industrials sector, showcasing a 5.95% year-to-date increase. While concerns exist regarding potential overvaluation due to a high price-to-book ratio and negative earnings, its robust liquidity and stable debt management highlight varying investor sentiments.

feed.title: Custom Truck One Source to Participate in the BofA Securities 2025 Leveraged Finance Conference
feed.summary: Custom Truck One Source, Inc. (NYSE: CTOS) announced that its CEO, Ryan McMonagle, and CFO, Chris Eperjesy, will participate in a fireside chat and meet with institutional investors at the BofA Securities 2025 Leveraged Finance Conference on Tuesday, December 2, 2025, at 11:30 a.m. ET. A live audio-only webcast of the presentation will be available on the Company’s Investor Relations website, with a replay archived for 30 days. Custom Truck One Source is a leading provider of specialty equipment and services to various infrastructure markets in North America.

feed.title: Boston Partners Raises Stake in Custom Truck One Source, Inc. $CTOS
feed.summary: Boston Partners significantly increased its stake in Custom Truck One Source (CTOS) by 19.6% in the second quarter, bringing their total ownership to 1.68% of the company's stock. Despite this, Custom Truck One Source has recently missed earnings estimates and analysts remain cautious, with a consensus "Hold" rating and a target price of $7.13. Other institutional investors also adjusted their holdings in the company.

feed.title: Custom Truck One Source, Inc. Reports Third Quarter 2025 Results and Reaffirms 2025 Guidance
feed.summary: Custom Truck One Source, Inc. (NYSE: CTOS) announced strong financial results for the third quarter of 2025, with an 8% increase in total revenue to $482.1 million and a 20% increase in Adjusted EBITDA to $96.0 million, driven by growth in core T&D markets. The company reaffirmed its full-year 2025 consolidated revenue and Adjusted EBITDA guidance, citing continued robust demand for vocational vehicles and expectations for high-single-digit fleet growth. Despite a decrease in TES backlog, CTOS remains confident in its ability to benefit from infrastructure investments and power demand for data centers and grid upgrades.

feed.title: Custom Truck One Source and Load King Manufacturing Unveil Newest Equipment at Utility Expo 2025
feed.summary: Custom Truck One Source (NYSE: CTOS) and its manufacturing arm, Load King Manufacturing, showcased new equipment at Utility Expo 2025, highlighting innovation in utility, infrastructure, and construction industries. Key unveilings included the Outback Series of tracked easement machines, the lightweight Voyager® AMX aluminum service truck, the heavy-duty PalGal Loader/Cable Rolloff, and an all-electric bucket truck. These new products are available nationwide through CTOS offering sales, rentals, and in-house financing.

feed.title: Custom Truck One Source Announces Opening of New Orlando, Florida Location to Serve Growing Demand
feed.summary: Custom Truck One Source, Inc. announced the opening of a new 20,000 square foot facility with 11 service bays in Orlando, Florida, effective October 1, 2025. This strategic move aims to better serve customers in Florida and the broader Southeast region by relocating rental service operations from Tampa to Orlando. CEO Ryan McMonagle emphasized that this decision reflects the company's long-term vision and commitment to supporting its business, employees, and customers.

feed.title: Custom Truck One Source, Inc. Reports Fourth Quarter and Full-Year 2024 Results
feed.summary: Custom Truck One Source, Inc. reported its fourth-quarter and full-year 2024 financial results, showing sequential improvements in revenue, net income, and Adjusted EBITDA for Q4, driven by strong performance in utility, infrastructure, rail, and telecom markets. Despite a full-year revenue decrease compared to 2023, the company achieved record quarterly and annual revenue for its TES segment and is optimistic about fiscal 2025 growth, supported by strategic investments and an improved supply chain. The company also provided a positive outlook for 2025, anticipating revenue between $1,970 million and $2,060 million and Adjusted EBITDA between $370 million and $390 million, along with significant free cash flow generation and debt reduction.

feed.title: Custom Truck One Source (NYSE:CTOS) Misses Q3 Revenue Estimates, Stock Drops
feed.summary: Custom Truck One Source (NYSE:CTOS) reported Q3 CY2025 revenue of $482.1 million, missing analyst estimates, though sales grew 7.8% year-on-year. The company's GAAP loss per share was in line with expectations, and full-year revenue and EBITDA guidance were close to or above analyst estimates respectively. Despite a "softer quarter" and a stock drop, the company's long-term sales growth and improved operating margin were noted.

feed.title: Custom Truck One Source, Inc. (CTOS) Reports Q3 Loss, Misses Revenue Estimates
feed.summary: Custom Truck One Source, Inc. (CTOS) reported a Q3 loss of $0.03 per share, meeting Zacks Consensus Estimate but missing the previous quarter's expectation by a significant margin. The company's revenues for Q3 2025 were $482.06 million, falling short of consensus estimates. Despite outperforming the S&P 500 year-to-date, CTOS currently holds a Zacks Rank #5 (Strong Sell) due to unfavorable estimate revisions.

feed.title: Custom Truck One Source Announces Third Quarter 2025 Earnings Release and Conference Call
feed.summary: Custom Truck One Source, Inc. (NYSE: CTOS) announced it will release its third-quarter 2025 financial results after market close on Monday, October 27, 2025. Management will host a conference call the following day, October 28, 2025, to discuss the results, with an audio-only webcast and financial presentation available online. The company specializes in providing equipment and services to critical infrastructure markets in North America.

feed.title: Custom Truck One Source Announces Third Quarter 2025 Earnings Release and Conference Call
feed.summary: Custom Truck One Source, Inc. (NYSE: CTOS) announced it will release its third-quarter 2025 financial results on Monday, October 27, 2025, after market close. Management will host a conference call on Tuesday, October 28, 2025, at 9:00 a.m. ET to discuss the results. An audio-only webcast and presentation will be available on the company's investors relations website.

feed.title: Custom Truck One Source Announces Third Quarter 2025 Earnings Release and Conference Call - Bakersfield.com
feed.summary: Custom Truck One Source, Inc. (NYSE: CTOS) announced it will release its financial results for the third quarter of 2025 after market close on Monday, October 27, 2025. Management will discuss the results in a conference call on Tuesday, October 28, 2025, at 10:00 a.m. ET. An audio-only webcast and financial presentation will be available on the company's investor relations page.

feed.title: Custom Truck One Source Announces Third Quarter 2025 Earnings Release and Conference Call - Bluefield Daily Telegraph
feed.summary: Custom Truck One Source, Inc. (NYSE: CTOS) announced it will release its third-quarter 2025 financial results after the market closes on Monday, October 27, 2025. The company will host a conference call on Tuesday, October 28, 2025, to discuss these results. An audio-only webcast and financial presentation will be available on their investor relations website.

feed.title: Custom Truck One Source Announces Third Quarter 2025 Earnings Release and Conference Call
feed.summary: Custom Truck One Source, Inc. (NYSE: CTOS) announced that it will release its third-quarter 2025 financial results after market close on Monday, October 27, 2025. Management will discuss these results during a conference call on Tuesday, October 28, 2025, at 11:00 a.m. ET. An audio-only webcast and financial information presentation will be available on the company's investor relations page.

feed.title: Reviewing Custom Truck One Source (NYSE:CTOS) and Solid Power (NASDAQ:SLDP) - Defense World
feed.summary: This article compares Custom Truck One Source (NYSE:CTOS) and Solid Power (NASDAQ:SLDP) across several financial and analytical metrics including institutional ownership, analyst recommendations, risk and volatility, profitability, and valuation. Custom Truck One Source is shown to outperform Solid Power in most categories, particularly in revenue and earnings.

feed.title: JP Morgan Raises Price Target for Custom Truck One Source (CTOS), Maintains Rating | CTOS Stock News - GuruFocus
feed.summary: JP Morgan has increased its price target for Custom Truck One Source (CTOS) from $5.50 to $6.00 while maintaining an 'Underweight' rating. This adjustment reflects an increase in the price target despite the continued 'Underweight' rating. Other analysts have recently issued more bullish ratings, with price targets as high as $8.00.

feed.title: Will New Equipment Launches Reveal a Shifting Innovation Edge for Custom Truck One Source (CTOS)? - Yahoo Finance
feed.summary: Custom Truck One Source (CTOS) unveiled new equipment, including an all-electric bucket truck and advanced tracked easement machines, at Utility Expo 2025, signaling innovation in adapting to evolving customer and environmental needs. These launches aim to strengthen CTOS's investment narrative by supporting recurring revenue and broadening demand, especially in rental growth, though the company still faces challenges with gross margin pressures and high leverage. Analysts' fair value estimates for CTOS range from US$5.50 to US$7.10, indicating varied outlooks on its future performance.

feed.title: Custom Truck One Source, Load King debut equipment at Utility Expo 2025
feed.summary: Custom Truck One Source and Load King Manufacturing launched a range of new equipment at Utility Expo 2025, focusing on innovative solutions for the utility, infrastructure, and construction industries. Highlights included the Outback Series of tracked easement machines, the lightweight Voyager AMX service truck, and the heavy-duty PalGal Loader/Cable Rolloff. Additionally, an all-electric bucket truck was showcased, with all four featured models available for sale, rental, and in-house financing nationwide.

feed.title: Custom Truck One Source to Participate in the BofA Securities 2024 Leveraged Finance Conference
feed.summary: Custom Truck One Source (NYSE: CTOS) announced that its President and CEO, Ryan McMonagle, and CFO, Chris Eperjesy, will participate in a fireside chat and meet with institutional investors at the BofA Securities 2024 Leveraged Finance Conference on December 3, 2024. A live audio-only webcast of the fireside chat will be available on the company's Investor Relations website. The company also highlights its role as a leading provider of specialty equipment and references recent financial results and upcoming events.

feed.title: Custom Truck One Source Acquires the Business of SOS Fleet Services, LLC, Expanding Gulf States Footprint and Service Capabilities
feed.summary: Custom Truck One Source, Inc. (NYSE: CTOS) has acquired SOS Fleet Services, LLC, a full-service repair facility in Alexandria, Louisiana. This acquisition adds over 30,000 square feet and an experienced team, significantly expanding Custom Truck's Gulf States service capabilities and national footprint to 39 locations. The move aims to better serve customers in the region, particularly those in the powerline industry.

feed.title: NYSE suspends trading in Custom Truck One Source warrants due to low prices
feed.summary: The NYSE has suspended trading in warrants for Custom Truck One Source, a Kansas City-based company that produces specialized work trucks. The suspension is due to low prices, and the company has stated it will not fight the exchange's decision.

feed.title: Custom Truck One Source Inc. posts big gains in Q3
feed.summary: Custom Truck One Source Inc. reported significant revenue and profit gains in the third quarter of 2023, driven by strong demand across its key markets. The company achieved a third consecutive quarter of record-setting vehicle production, leading to increased fleet additions and strong year-over-year growth in new vehicle sales. Custom Truck One Source Inc. also improved its revenue outlook for 2023 and expects a seasonally strong fourth quarter.

feed.title: Dealer Tire Names Brad Meader as Chief Financial Officer
feed.summary: Dealer Tire has appointed Brad Meader as Partner and Chief Financial Officer, where he will support the growth of the Enterprise and its family of companies. Meader brings extensive finance, M&A, and capital markets experience, having previously served as CFO at Marcone Group and Custom Truck One Source. This strategic hire aims to drive long-term value creation and support Dealer Tire's overall growth strategy.

feed.title: Class Notes: May 2021
feed.summary: This article, "Class Notes: May 2021," highlights career achievements and appointments of Fordham Law alumni from various graduating classes. It details promotions, new roles in firms and corporations, judicial appointments, and candidacies for public office across the legal and business sectors.

feed.title: Nesco Holdings completes acquisition of Custom Truck One Source, changes its name
feed.summary: Nesco Holdings Inc. has completed its acquisition of Custom Truck One Source (CTOS) for $1.475 billion and subsequently changed its name to Custom Truck One Source Inc. The newly combined entity, headquartered in Kansas City, Mo., becomes a leading provider of specialty rental equipment for infrastructure markets, with its shares now trading on the NYSE under the ticker symbol “CTOS”. Platinum Equity LLC has become the majority stockholder, with existing CTOS equity holders and Nesco's previous major owners retaining minority stakes.

feed.title: Nesco Holdings Completes Acquisition of Custom Truck One Source in Partnership with Platinum Equity and Changes Its Name to Custom Truck One Source, Inc.
feed.summary: Nesco Holdings, Inc. announced the completion of its acquisition of Custom Truck One Source, L.P. for $1.475 billion, in partnership with Platinum Equity, LLC. Following the acquisition, Nesco Holdings has been renamed Custom Truck One Source, Inc., with its shares trading on the NYSE under the ticker symbol "CTOS" starting April 5, 2021. The combined entity is now a leading provider of specialized truck and heavy equipment solutions, aiming to serve infrastructure end markets like energy grids, 5G build-out, and rail.

feed.title: Nesco Holdings, Inc. to Become Custom Truck One Source, Inc., Change Ticker Symbol to CTOS
feed.summary: Nesco Holdings, Inc. announced its plan to change its name to Custom Truck One Source, Inc. following the proposed acquisition of Custom Truck One Source, L.P. The company will also change its NYSE ticker symbol from "NSCO" to "CTOS" and its redeemable warrants symbol from "NSCO.WS" to "CTOS.WS" upon the closing of the acquisition. The announcement also included forward-looking statements regarding potential risks and uncertainties related to the acquisition and economic conditions.

feed.title: Nesco Holdings' Shareholders Approve the Proposals Required to Consummate the Acquisition of Custom Truck One Source in Partnership with Platinum Equity
feed.summary: Nesco Holdings, Inc. announced that its shareholders approved the necessary proposals for the acquisition of Custom Truck One Source. The acquisition, in partnership with Platinum Equity, is expected to close in the first quarter of 2021, subject to customary closing conditions. This approval moves Nesco closer to expanding its specialized equipment and service offerings.

feed.title: Kansas City trucking business sold for more than $1.4 billion
feed.summary: Nesco Holdings, Inc. has announced its agreement to acquire Custom Truck One Source (CTOS), a Kansas City trucking business, for $1.475 billion. The acquisition aims to create a leading one-stop-shop provider of specialty rental equipment, serving infrastructure markets. Platinum Equity, LLC will invest $850 million into Nesco for a majority interest.

feed.title: Latham Advises Nesco Holdings in US$1.475 Billion Acquisition of Custom Truck One Source and its Partnership with Platinum Equity
feed.summary: Latham & Watkins LLP advised Nesco Holdings in its definitive agreement to acquire Custom Truck One Source (CTOS) for US$1.475 billion. In conjunction with the acquisition, an affiliate of Platinum Equity, LLC will invest over US$850 million into Nesco in exchange for newly issued common stock. The transaction combines two leading providers of specialized truck and heavy equipment solutions.

feed.title: Propane Truck Innovations And Sales Keep On Rolling
feed.summary: Despite challenges from COVID-19, propane truck sales and innovations have continued steadily. Suppliers report adapting to supply chain issues and seeing increased demand for larger tank sizes and customized features, as well as new safety and efficiency technologies. The industry is also seeing "tweener" bobtails and larger transport trucks to maximize delivery capacity.

feed.title: KC company finds another gear as it hits $1B revenue mark
feed.summary: Custom Truck One Source, a family-operated company based in Kansas City, has achieved a significant milestone by surpassing $1 billion in revenue. The company has grown to employ 1,700 individuals, a testament to its expansion and success. Executives are discussing this achievement and future growth plans.

feed.title: Custom Truck One Source creates 61 new jobs
feed.summary: Custom Truck One Source is investing $2.6 million into its manufacturing operations in Bedford County, expecting to create 61 new jobs. This marks the third expansion for the company in 10 years, which has grown from 17 employees in 2008 to 192 today. The Bedford County Economic Development Authority is providing a cash incentive to support this growth and investment.
